alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 9:06PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Big Horn and south central Yellowstone Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 905 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles southeast of Lockwood, or 21 miles southeast of Billings, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Big Horn and south central Yellowstone Counties. This storm will not impact the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone
